channel.title: : Perfect lumbridge pvp and safe area {pi} coords

item.title: : Perfect lumbridge pvp and safe area {pi} coords
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Dan0194, post:4, topic:545703”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=664586.msg4442761#msg4442761 date=1407381249]
You could use the AWT Polygon class and just check if the player is in that polygon. Something like

In your Player class

public boolean isWithin(final Location[] locations) {
    final Polygon polygon = new Polygon();
    for (final Location location : locations) {
        final int x = location.getX();
        final int y = location.getY();
        polygon.addPoint(x, y);
    }
    final int playerX = getLocation().getX();
    final int playerY = getLocation().getY();
    if (polygon.contains(playerX, playerY)) {
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}

For this you only need to include the vertex points of the polygon in order (ie. adjacent to each other).
[/quote]

Wow that’s pretty cool gonna add that btw I don’t understand why people just don’t do

Many users don’t know about it, or don’t know about the rules when using it. It was always defined as a square in wL-era programming, and was just never really changed.

Read full topic

item.title: : Perfect lumbridge pvp and safe area {pi} coords
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

You could use the AWT Polygon class and just check if the player is in that polygon. Something like

In your Player class

public boolean isWithin(final Location[] locations) {
    final Polygon polygon = new Polygon();
    for (final Location location : locations) {
        final int x = location.getX();
        final int y = location.getY();
        polygon.addPoint(x, y);
    }
    final int playerX = getLocation().getX();
    final int playerY = getLocation().getY();
    if (polygon.contains(playerX, playerY)) {
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}

For this you only need to include the vertex points of the polygon in order (ie. adjacent to each other).

item.title: : Perfect lumbridge pvp and safe area {pi} coords
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“I Smoke Kush, post:1, topic:545703”]public boolean inLumbridge() {
return(absX > 3200 && absX < 3232 && absY > 3200 && absY < 3237);
}

Basically I know how to do all this shit, but cant make the area perfect pvp and safe zone, because the walls are not even, can anyone help please…[/quote]

Divide it into smaller areas and check every area

return ((absX > 3200 && absX < 3232 && absY > 3200 && absY < 3237)
&& (absX > 3012 && absX < 2356 …));

Read full topic

return(absX > 3200 && absX < 3232 && absY > 3200 && absY < 3237);
}

Basically I know how to do all this shit, but cant make the area perfect pvp and safe zone, because the walls are not even, can anyone help please…
